Package Model

Class Player

java.lang.Object
Model.Player
public class Player extends Object
Represents a player in the game.
Author:
Disha Padsala

      Parameters:

      Checks if the player has enough unallocated armies to deploy.
      Parameters:
      p_player - The player attempting to deploy armies.
      p_noOfArmiesToDeploy - The number of armies the player wants to deploy.
      Returns:

      private boolean validateCountryBelongstoPlayer(Player p_player, String p_countryName)
      Validates whether a given country belongs to the specified player.
      Parameters:
      p_player - The player whose ownership is being checked.
      p_countryName - The name of the country to verify.
      Returns:
      true if the country belongs to the player; otherwise, false.

    • checkForMoreOrder

      public void checkForMoreOrder()
      Prompts the player to check if they want to give more orders in the next turn. Reads user input from the console and sets the player's order status accordingly.

    • createAdvanceOrder

      public void createAdvanceOrder(String p_inputCommand, CurrentState p_currentState)
      Creates an advance order based on the given command.
      Parameters:
      p_inputCommand - The advance command in the format advance <SourceCountry> <TargetCountry> <NoOfArmies>.
      p_currentState - The current state of the game, used for validation.

    • checkAdjacentCountry

      private boolean checkAdjacentCountry(String p_sourceCountry, String p_targetCountry, CurrentState p_currentState)
      Checks whether the target country is adjacent to the source country.
      Parameters:
      p_sourceCountry - The name of the source country.
      p_targetCountry - The name of the target country.
      p_currentState - The current state of the game, used to retrieve country details.
      Returns:
      true if the target country is adjacent to the source country; otherwise, false.

    • checkCountryPresent

      private boolean checkCountryPresent(String p_sourceCountry, CurrentState p_currentState)
      Checks if a given country exists on the map. If the country is not found, logs an error message.
      Parameters:
      p_sourceCountry - The name of the country to check.
      p_currentState - The current state of the game, used to look up the country.
      Returns:
      true if the country exists; otherwise, false.

    • handleCardCommand

      public void handleCardCommand(String p_inputCommand, CurrentState p_currentState)
      Handles the execution of card commands based on the given input. The input command is parsed, and depending on the card type (e.g., bomb, blockade),
      Parameters:
      p_inputCommand - The command input for the card action (e.g., bomb country_name).
      p_currentState - The current state of the game used for order validation.

    • checkCardArguments

      private boolean checkCardArguments(String[] p_commandParts)
      Validates the arguments provided for the card command. Ensures that the correct number of arguments is passed based on the card type.
      Parameters:
      p_commandParts - The parts of the input command (split by spaces).
      Returns:
      true if the arguments are valid; otherwise, false.

      public void assignCard()

    • negotiationValidation

      public boolean negotiationValidation(String p_targetCountryName)
      Validates if a player can negotiate with a target country. A player cannot negotiate if they control the target country.
      Parameters:
      p_targetCountryName - The name of the target country for negotiation.
      Returns:
      true if negotiation is possible (the player does not control the target country); false otherwise.

    • getCountryNames

      public List<String> getCountryNames()

      A list of country names controlled by the player.

      Parameters:
      p_cardName - The name of the card to be removed.
